description.narrative: #YES, I CAN!# project is proposed by consortium that involves Research and Community Development Institute of Atma Jaya Catholic University, OPSI # the National Association of Sex Workers (Organisasi Perubahan Sosial Indonesia); SWARA # Association of Young Transgender; and eRKA or Yayasan Rumah Kita # community based organization that takes care of marginalized children. "Yes, I can!" project aims to improve the quality of life of marginalized groups by means of improving their access to basic services and improve the economic and social status of the target group of this project. This project offers innovations in empowering the target groups in a professional manner which will be implemented over 30 months. One of the core activities that will be undertaken include the provision of professional education program (selected profession in the formal sectors such as nursing, hospitality, profession, mechanics or automotive, health and beauty consultant, etc. # depends on mapping) which will be standardized, certified, and recognized professionally in the community. The curriculum of the proposed certified educational program will be taught and monitored by accredited experts in the private sector under the coordination of LPPM (Lembaga Penelitian dan Pengabdian Masyarakat) and HIV <(>&<)> AIDS Research Center (PPH UAJ). PPH UAJ will be responsible as the project coordinator as this research institution has been able to demonstrate its portofolio in providing sustainable services to marginalized communities (seeprofile of KIOS <(>&<)> LAP; Ajisuksmo et al., 2017). This professional education program will be run between 6 and 12 months. The focus of educational program will be chosen basedon the needs of the community and the possible eagerness of the market. The syllabus and content of each program will be reviewed and supervised by people who are very competent in their respective fields. Another important component of the proposed project is called reflective and skill enhancement activity. This activity comprisesof a broad range of activities that improve self-esteem, reduce self-stigma and inculcate professionalism among the target group. Among those are the provision of knowledge-based trainings suchas health human rights and access to justice, leadership andorganizational management, professional conduct, and entrepreneur skills. The results of this project will be advocated to the governments, public and private sectors, the community. Advocacy will be conducted in collaborative and solution focused mannerin conjunction with other activities throughout the project timeline. The ultimate goals of this project is to help each participant to be recognized professionally and enjoy equal opportunities in the job market without discrimination. At the end of this project, an independent clinic will be established to accommodate some participants# ideas to become an entrepreneur.

participating-org.narrative: HIV and AIDS Research Center Atma Jaya Catholic University

HIV/AIDS Research Center at Atma Jaya Catholic University (Pusat Penelitian HIV/AIDS or PPH) is one of 5 research centers managed under the Research and Community Development Institute (Lembaga Penelitian dan Pengembangan Masyarakat or LPPM). LPPM has been established since February, 1st 1997 through Atma Jaya Foundation Decree No. 006/I/SK/01/97. While HIV/AIDS Research Center (PPH) or AIDS Research Center was established through the Atma Jaya Foundation Decree No. 077/I/SK-LL/04/2010. PPH focuses on policy research related to HIV/AIDS issues both at national and sub-national level. We were engaged in the studies of HIV and AIDS since mid-1990s. But only in 2010 all HIV and AIDS related projects managed by a single institution. Among other community health related concerns, HIV and AIDS was one of very few epidemics that will impoverish families, disturb social cohesiveness due to stigma and discrimination, and difficult to intervene due life-style, cultural beliefs and practices that help maintain risky behaviour. Therefore, our programsare focusing on: (1) Research in social, behaviours, and preventions of HIV/AIDS; (2) Operational and transactional research; (3) Research in health policy; and (4) Community development programs that are related to HIV/AIDS Programs for people living with HIV especially for key-affected populations (e.g., Injected drug users, etc.).
